  • Tenemos una cultura de mejora continua: Te integrarás en un proyecto retador que impulsará tus conocimientos y experiencia. 🚀
  • Crecimiento profesional: Apostamos por el crecimiento de nuestro equipo y priorizamos la promoción interna. 🏆
  • Cercanía: Nunegal lo formamos personas, no números. Nos conocemos por el nombre. 👪 👨‍👩‍👧 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦
  • Buen rollo😃: Somos un equipo, nos ayudamos y compartimos conocimientos. Además, somos conocidos por nuestro #Nunefest🎸


¿Cómo será tu día a día? 📲💻

  • Aplicar conocimientos en programación, matemáticas y estadística para recopilar, extraer y procesar información relevante de bases de datos.


Sobre ti... 🙎🏼‍♀️🙎🏾‍♂️

  • Experiencia profesional previa como Data Scientist.
  • Experiencia trabajando con Python y SQL.
  • Experiencia en entorno Cloud.
  • Experiencia en generación de modelos de machine learning
  • Experiencia en detección de anomalías
  • Experiencia en forecasting


Otros datos… 📄

  • Incorporación a una empresa en constante crecimiento.
  • Modalidad de contratación indefinida.
  • 100% Teletrabajo.
  • Formación continúa.
  • Seguro médico subvencionado en parte por la empresa para el trabajador, su cónyuge e hijos.
  • Ticket restaurante.
  • ¡Y muchas sorpresas más!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At TomTom we’re seeking a Data Scientist to join our Maps Quality and Product Insight team in Madrid. As part of the team, you will help TomTom deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps and locations services for the hundreds of millions of drivers and users of our maps and products around the world and that will enable the future of autonomous driving.

The Maps Quality and Insight team is focused on providing state-of-the-art data & analytics solutions that enable fast and cost-effective data-driven strategic decision making within TomTom and for our customers and partners.  

The impact you'll make


Drive strategic business decisions with insights obtained by manipulating large volumes of data from a variety of different sources:  system logs, satellite imagery, vertical imagery, street level imagery, GPS traces, etc. individually and by fusing several combinations of these sources
Design, develop and maintain data processing pipelines to use these data sources individually or combined and to predict various map features and attributes by applying statistical models/ ML / AI models  
State the quality level of our maps via statistical experiments that help us understand where we are and why, and deliver effective insights that help drive our map editing strategy 
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model and system performance and data accuracy 
Collaborate with teams from diverse backgrounds (e.g., data scientists, software engineers, product managers, map and GIS experts …) across the company and with our customers on projects and knowledge sharing 


What you'll need


Minimum 3+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist or Software Engineer (with relevant experience in data analytics projects)
Bachelor’s/Masters in Computer science, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent field 
Good communications skills in English
Strong problem-solving skills
To be team-oriented – to be able to communicate with other team members, express doubts, provide and accept constructive feedback
To be passionate about programming and have a solid foundation of software development, and be always eager to learn and improve your skills
Fair statistical knowledge and expertise in designing and testing experiments and drawing conclusions under uncertainty (sampling strategies, robust statistical estimation,...)
Experience in at least one object-oriented language – Python is a must, PySpark and Scala is a plus
Experience in various ML / AI techniques and frameworks
Knowledge of SQL and databases
Experience in processing and analysing data to draw insights and produce visualizations (data storitelling)
A passion for learning new technologies and techniques and a curiosity for exploring new possibilities and challenges


What Is Nice To Have


Work experience in Big Data and cloud ecosystems (e.g., Spark, Databricks, Azure, AWS, GCP…).
Prior experience with working with geospatial and map data and/or with NoSQL databases


What We Offer

A competitive compensation package, of course.

Time and resources to grow and develop, including a personal development budget and paid leave for learning days, as well as paid access to e-learning resources such as O’Reilly and LinkedIn Learning.

Time to support life outside of work, with enhanced parental leave plus paid leave to care for loved ones and volunteer in local communities.

Work flexibility, where TomTom’ers, in agreement with their manager and team, use both the office and home to focus, collaborate, learn and socialize. It’s all about getting the best out of both worlds – we ask TomTom’ers to come to the office two days a week, and the remaining three are free to be worked in either location.

Improve your home office with a setup budget and get extra support with a monthly allowance.

Enjoy options to work from your home country and abroad for a set number of days each year, to visit family and friends, or to simply explore the world we’re mapping.

Take the holidays you want with a competitive holiday plan, plus an extra day off to celebrate your birthday.

Join annual events like our Hackathon and DevDays to bring your ideas to life with talented teammates from around the world.

Become a part of our inclusive global culture and have the chance to collaborate with a diverse community – we have over 80 nationalities at TomTom!

Find out more about our global benefits and enjoy additional local benefits tailored to your location.

Meet your team

We’re Maps, a global team within TomTom’s Location Technology Products technical unit. Our team is driven to deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps for hundreds of millions of users around the world. Joining our team, you’ll continuously innovate our mapmaking processes, directly contributing to our vision: engineering the world's most trusted and useful map.

At TomTom...

You’ll help people find their way in the world. In 2004, TomTom revolutionized how the world moves with the introduction of the first portable navigation device. Now, we intend to do it again by engineering the first-ever real-time map, the smartest and most useful map on the planet.

Work with a team of 3,700 unique, curious and passionate problem-solvers. Together, we’ll open up a world of possibilities for car manufacturers, enterprises and developers to help people understand and get closer to the world around them.

After you apply

Our recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout your journey with us, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews all the way through onboarding. To find out more about our application process, check out our hiring FAQs.

TomTom is an equal opportunity employer

TomTom is where you can find your place in the world. Every day we welcome, nurture and celebrate differences. Why? Because your uniqueness is what makes you, you. No matter your culture or background, you’ll find your impact at TomTom. Research also shows that sometimes women and underrepresented communities can be hesitant to apply for positions unless they believe they meet 100% of the criteria. If you can relate to this, please know that we’d love to hear from you.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Hi! 👋🏼

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for an AI Engineer to take our Product team to the next level 🚀


Team and Role


If you have experience in developing AI systems, thrive in dynamic startup environments, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to gain full experience within a rapidly growing startup. We are a small, highly committed team with strong connections to other teams, so you'll have the chance to learn and grow quickly. There's a lot to be done! If you're excited about working in an innovative and fast-paced environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is your opportunity! 🤩


What you´ll be doing


Your day-to-day as an AI Engineer

As an AI Engineer, you will work hand in hand with one of our Squads to contribute to the key areas of the AI team, primarily:


Development of conversational systems: You will design, implement, and optimize AI products, chatbots, and virtual assistants that enhance the experience of our users.
Integration of third-party AI APIs: You will work with APIs such as OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini AI, etc., integrating them effectively into our solutions.
Implementation of RAG systems (Retrieval Augmented Generation): You will create systems that combine knowledge bases with generative models for precise and contextualized responses.
Development with specialized libraries: You will use LangChain, LlamaIndex, LangFlow, and our own framework to build robust and scalable AI solutions.
Model evaluation and testing: You will implement evaluation methodologies to continuously measure and improve the performance of our models.
Cost and performance optimization: You will work on continuously improving our AI systems, balancing quality, speed, and operational costs.
Cross-disciplinary collaboration: You will work with product, engineering, and business teams to align AI solutions with strategic objectives.
Applied research: You will stay up-to-date with the latest advances in AI and evaluate new technologies for potential implementation.
What we´re looking for


We need someone who...


Has 4 years of experience programming AI solutions in Python, especially in startup or tech company environments.
Has experience with conversational systems and chatbots using large language models (LLMs).
Has worked with third-party AI APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Hugging Face, etc.).
Has experience in prompt engineering, dynamic prompt declaration, CoT, and self-evaluation methods.


It’s very important that you...


Are familiar with and have implemented RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) systems.
Have experience with libraries like LangChain, LlamaIndex, or LangFlow.
Follow best development practices: version control, documentation, unit testing, etc.
Are up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in generative AI.


You’re perfect for us if you also have experience in...


Knowledge of Docker, CI/CD, deployment, and DevOps.
Knowledge of ML, predictive AI, recommendation systems.
Experience working with cloud providers such as AWS Bedrock, Microsoft Azure, or Gemini Vertex.
Experience building APIs with frameworks like FastAPI or similar.
Experience implementing testing and evaluation methodologies for AI models.
What's in it for you?


Compensation 💰

The salary range for this position is between 36.000€ and 51.750€ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:


Between 36.000€ & 45.000€ fixed salary.
Up to 15% (6.750€) quarterly bonus based on performance & potential.


Why you´ll love working at Shakers 💚


Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. 🌍
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture—ask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Velázquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.


At the office... 📍


Organic fruit
Free caffeine and theine
Our recruitment process


As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this May, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!

The Road to Joining Our Team


Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don’t worry—we just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check, CEO Chat: Meet Héctor, our CEO! He’s excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers’ future, and discuss your vision and expectations.


More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!

Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM 🏆

We all feel like part of a winning team—one that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 💪🏼

We’re building an environment where fear doesn’t hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren’t afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE 🤲🏼

We embrace a beginner’s mindset—always evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!

A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
¡Bienvenido/a al lugar que te mereces!




🔎¿Qué buscamos?




Buscamos un/a Desarrollador/a Python con al menos 2 años de experiencia.




Te buscamos, independientemente de tu género, capacidades diferentes, orientación sexual, origen étnico o cualquier característica que te haga único/a.




✨Qué esperamos de ti✨




Experiencia en Python.
Conocimiento de la librería Pandas, especialmente en desarrollos que tienen gran volumen de datos.
Conocimientos de estadística y matemáticas financieras, puesto que hay que saber interpretar fórmulas matemáticas con logaritmos, aproximaciones, raíces, etc.
Nivel de inglés B2-C1.







😎 Qué responsabilidades tendrás




Tareas de desarrollo: programar índices bursátiles de acuerdo a la definición formal, programar herramientas y scripts para el día a día.
Tareas de soporte: gestionar comunicación con Alpima, Refinitiv, Bloomberg.
Monitorización: comprobar archivos y ejecución diaria de los índices.
Infraestructura: arquitectura airflow, directorios s3, conexión con el SaaS de Alpima, decidir desarrollos y mejoras o workarounds respecto al proveedor.







💙 Qué tenemos de especial




2000€ anuales para seguir formándote.
Ayuda alimentaria y gastos de teletrabajo.
¡30 días entre vacaciones y días de libre disposición al año!
Jornada intensiva los viernes y dos meses y medio en verano.
Modelo de teletrabajo perfecto para la conciliación y disfrute de tu tiempo libre y horario flexible para que seas tú quien decida cómo organizar tu tiempo.
Ayudas para familiares con discapacidad.
Sistema de retribución flexible (transporte, seguro médico de Sanitas, Movistar...).
Ventajas en productos financieros BBVA (hipotecas, préstamos, tarjetas, seguros, etc.).
Modelo de talento enfocado en perfiles tecnológicos. Proporcionamos herramientas y oportunidades para crecer y destacar tus habilidades.

Además…

Te sentirás acompañado/a desde tu primer día, tanto en el proyecto, como en la compañía. Nuestros onboarding son famosos 😏
El compañerismo es parte de nuestro ADN. Estarás en un equipo con gente majísima.
Entorno multidisciplinario con metodologías Agile.
Tus proyectos tendrán impacto en el mundo financiero y en la sociedad.
Nos gusta disfrutar y asistir a fiestas, eventos, actividades… porque trabajar es solo la excusa.




Entonces… ¿Qué nos dices? ¿Hacemos match? 💙

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Xebia

With over 20 years of experience, our global network of passionate technologists and pioneering craftsmen deliver cutting-edge technology and game-changing consulting to companies on the brink of transformation. Since 2001, we have grown from a Java company into a full-service digital consulting company with 5,500+ professionals working on a worldwide ambition.

We are organized in complementary service lines – teams with a tremendous amount of knowledge and experience within a particular field, such as Agile, DevOps, Data and AI, Cloud, Software Technology, Functional Programming, Intelligent Automation, and Microsoft.

We help the world’s top 250+ companies and category leaders overcome digital challenges, embrace innovation, adopt new technology, and implement new business models. In addition to high-quality consulting, we also provide offshoring and nearshoring services.

For more details, please visit www.xebia.com




Job Description




• Work with data scientists, analysts, engineers and product management to

implement enhancements, develop new features and work through business

requirements into our data science and analytics initiatives.

• Deliver on a wide spectrum of data-related tasks, ranging from reporting and

analytics requests, to the implementation and analysis of machine learning

models

• Develop good quality code that is easily scaled and automated

• Work alongside engineers to ensure seamless integration of your work with tools

that are live in a production environment




Example Projects




Besides driving the transformation into a data-driven enterprise in general, here

are some specific projects you will work on and contribute to:

• Pricing and Promotion recommendation tools

• Pricing elasticity modeling




About You




• University or advanced degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics,

or a related field

• 4+ years' experience developing data science and analytics solutions in a

business setting

• Experience with regression, linear/non-linear optimization, classification and

segmentation problems

• Strong Python skills required, especially with Pandas, common machine learning

libraries and PySpark

• Strong SQL skills

• Solid analytical skills, ability to derive conclusions and questions from data

patterns

• Efficient with git and Github.

• Familiarity with Google Cloud (GCP), Docker and orchestration tools is a plus

• Experience using visualization tools like Tableau or Looker Studio is a plus

• Understanding of basic software engineering best practices to write reusable

code that can easily go into production

• Team player, always willing to support your colleagues to the best of your ability

• Proactive mindset towards problem-solving, a “can-do” attitude is expected







Xebia is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, or age.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer to join a leading global alternative investment fund with a focus on AI and Data. You will be part of an exciting journey of a start-up within a global fund. As the AI Engineer, part of this role will be to help build the culture and environment as we expand our footprint. Working with LLM, AI and theoretical machine learning fundamentals

Please note – You must have demonstration of academic excellence via a bachelor's degree in computer science, mathematics, a hard science, or a related field, ideally from a top university.

This role will be fully office based; you must be open to working in the Madrid office. Must hold EU citizenship or TIE for Spain

What's on offer to you?

Be part of a start up office within a global organisation
Cutting edge AI projects
Ownership of technical products and projects

What You Will Be Doing

With AI at their core –Actively engage with a wide range of business functions to leverage their deep machine learning knowledge and exposure
Design and delivery of systems and machine learning models that solve commercially impactful real world problems
Framing business problems and commercial opportunities into AI problems - judgement and acumen to understand the true business need beyond the stated requirements
Challenging current systems and processes to achieve common goals through technical excellence and innovation
Keeping abreast of progress in AI and technology trends that will keep us at the forefront of what is possible
Having impact from day one – we empower and trust the AI engineers to leverage their skillsets

What You Will Need to Succeed in This Role

Essential - Demonstration of academic excellence via a bachelor's degree in computer science, mathematics, a hard science, or a related field, ideally from a top university
Deep understanding of theoretical machine learning fundamentals as well as practical knowledge of how to build real world ML systems
Direct experience leveraging LLMs in production, and an in depth understanding of prompt design, agentic workflows, eval harnesses, retrieval pipelines, etc.
Exposure to LLM inference stack fundamentals such as KV Caching, Speculative Decoding, Parallel Decoding, and test-time compute ideas.
Excellent programming, technology, and system design skills, including an in-depth understanding of and recent programming experience with Python and ideally one of C++, Java, or .Net
Experience working with SQL databases
Azure or AWS experience
An entrepreneurial nature, willing to take ownership and run towards problems and someone who thrives on innovation
The ability to own all aspects of an AI project from start to finish
Financial Services experience a bonus, but is not essential

AI Engineer | Madrid | AI | LLM | Python | LLM

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
En PALATIN conectamos profesionales con nuevas oportunidades.




Actualmente, buscamos un Data Engineer con experiencia en Spark y Scala para formar parte de un equipo dinámico y altamente cualificado. Si buscas un entorno en el que puedas crecer profesionalmente y afrontar nuevos retos en el ámbito del Big Data y Cloud, esta es tu oportunidad.




¿Qué harás en este rol?




Diseñar y desarrollar arquitecturas de procesamiento de datos en tiempo real y por lotes utilizando Scala/Python y Apache Spark.
Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con diferentes equipos para definir y transformar los requisitos de datos en soluciones técnicas eficientes.
Optimizar sistemas de procesamiento de datos para garantizar su rendimiento y escalabilidad.
Implementar prácticas avanzadas para garantizar la integridad y calidad de los datos.
Mantenerse al día con las últimas tendencias en tecnologías de Big Data y Cloud.




¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Formación en Ingeniería Informática, Ciencias de la Computación o un campo afín.
Al menos 2 años de experiencia trabajando con Scala en entornos de Big Data.
Conocimientos sólidos en Apache Spark y desarrollo de pipelines de datos a gran escala.
Experiencia en el diseño y construcción de procesos ETL/ELT en la nube (Databricks, Azure, AWS o GCP).
Dominio de técnicas de modelado de datos (relacional, dimensional, etc.).
Valoraremos positivamente si además tienes experiencia diseñando soluciones en la nube (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Conocimiento en herramientas Agile y gestión de proyectos (JIRA, Confluence, etc.); experiencia previa con Kafka y certificaciones en tecnologías de Big Data o Cloud Computing.




¿Qué ofrecemos?




Contrato indefinido y estabilidad en una compañía en crecimiento.
Plan de carrera individualizado para potenciar tu desarrollo profesional.
Modelo remoto de trabajo, o híbrido
Teletrabajo en periodos especiales: Navidades, Semana Santa, julio y agosto.
Horario flexible y medidas de conciliación.
Plan de formación continua, para que sigas evolucionando.
Beneficios corporativos: Retribución flexible, seguro médico, actividades de equipo y eventos internos.
Un entorno que impulsa la innovación y el crecimiento personal, fomentando la autonomía y el equilibrio entre la vida personal y profesional.
Participación en iniciativas sociales y solidarias enfocadas en educación, juventud y conocimiento.




Si te apasionan los desafíos tecnológicos y quieres ser parte de una empresa donde realmente puedas hacer la diferencia, no dudes en inscribirte




¡Queremos conocerte!

Title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer 🚀
Description:
¡excelia es una firma multinacional líder en Consultoría, Tecnología y Servicios profesionales, con más de 25 años de trayectoria marcada por la excelencia! Operamos en más de 50 países de Europa, América Latina y Estados Unidos 🌎, desde nuestras 10 oficinas estratégicamente ubicadas.




🚀 ¡Estamos contratando! Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer







🎯 Responsabilidades del rol:




Extraer y analizar datos para impulsar la mejora de productos digitales en sectores innovadores.
Evaluar nuevas fuentes de datos y aplicar técnicas de recopilación efectivas.
Desarrollar modelos personalizados de IA a partir de datos estructurados y no estructurados.
Aplicar modelado predictivo para optimizar experiencias, ingresos, segmentación y más.
Diseñar pruebas A/B y definir métricas claras para evaluar el rendimiento de los modelos.
Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinares para implementar modelos y monitorizar resultados.
Crear herramientas para el análisis y supervisión del rendimiento de modelos y calidad de datos.




🧠 ¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Máster o Doctorado en Estadística, Matemáticas, Ciencias de la Computación u otra disciplina cuantitativa.
Entre 5 y 7 años de experiencia en proyectos de ciencia de datos o inteligencia artificial.
Dominio de Python y familiaridad con librerías clave del ecosistema (Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).
Experiencia en técnicas de aprendizaje automático: árboles de decisión, redes neuronales, clustering, boosting, etc.
Conocimientos sólidos de estadística avanzada y modelado.
Experiencia en proyectos de LLMs, NLP, Computer Vision, análisis de series temporales o IA Generativa.
Familiaridad con herramientas de control de versiones y colaboración (Git, GitLab, etc.).
Alta capacidad de resolución de problemas y orientación al desarrollo de producto.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y trabajo en equipo.







¿Qué ofrecemos?

📝 Contratación estable, para que puedas seguir creciendo junto a nosotros.

💰 Tu banda salarial será acorde a tu experiencia y tu trayectoria profesional.

📊 Retribución flexible a través de la tarjea COBEE.

📖 Creemos en tu desarrollo profesional, por ello te ofrecemos formación continua. Queremos ayudarte a mejorar tus habilidades técnicas.

⏰ Jornada flexible, Jornada intensiva todos los viernes del años, Julio y Agosto.




¿Listo para liderar el camino en la protección de datos y sistemas? ¡Haz clic en "inscribirme" y únete a excelia!

Title: Data Science Middle
Description:
¿Quienes somos?

VML The Cocktail es una compañía de transformación creativa, que trabaja con el objetivo de combinar creatividad, diseño, tecnología y datos para crear productos, marcas, servicios y empresas que se relacionan con las personas, diseñando historias para el día de mañana.

Trabajamos en proyectos end to end con nuestros clientes, desde que surge una necesidad hasta todo el desarrollo y la implementación de los mismos. Nos gusta entender a fondo el reto de cada proyecto y, con todo el talento que tenemos en casa, nos aseguramos de llevarlo a cabo con éxito.







El área de Data & Marketing

Desde Data Marketing, estamos buscando al mejor talento para incorporarse a nuestro equipo. En esta área trabajan más de 200 profesionales abarcando todas las capacidades que engloban el mundo del dato y del marketing digital. Es un área en pleno crecimiento y con grandes retos por delante.




¿Por qué estamos creciendo tanto?

Como partners del año de Salesforce, estamos a la vanguardia de la tecnología y ofrecemos las soluciones más innovadoras a nuestros clientes
Nos destacamos en el mercado por nuestro enfoque integral
Tomamos decisiones estratégicas basadas en datos
Trabajamos en entornos globales




¿Quieres ser parte de este crecimiento? Esto es lo que buscamos:

Estamos buscando un Data Scientist creativo y orientado a resultados para unirse a nuestro equipo. En este rol, tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar con grandes volúmenes de datos, descubrir patrones clave y aportar insights valiosos que impulsarán nuestras decisiones estratégicas.




Si disfrutas resolver problemas complejos, experimentar con algoritmos avanzados y convertir números en historias, ¡queremos conocerte! 🚀




Responsabilidades

Trabajamos en entorno cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure) y usamos las herramientas adecuadas para cada problema en concreto.
Traducir las necesidades de negocio a modelos predictivos, su dimensionamiento y productivización, así como la activación y monitorización de estas predicciones en relación a los OKRs.
Desarollar modelos matemáticos avanzados basados en técnicas de machine learning, especialmente en modelos predictivos de clasificación (i.e., bagging, boosting) y clusterización (i.e., K-means, Mean Shift).




Requisitos:

Experiencia de al menos 3 años en las funciones descritas.
Tener conocimientos de desarrollo de software, Object Oriented Programing, y manejo avanzado de Python: estructuras de datos y principales librerías (i.e., numpy, pandas, sklearn, Keras, Tensorflow, Pytorch).
Conocimientos de bases de datos relacionales y fuentes no relacionales/NoSQL.
Experiencia en metodología DevOps, contribución a repositorios git, monitorización del código mediante builds (docker) y testing, así como despliegues en entornos de UAT y productivos.
Experiencia en metodología MLOps, paquetización de modelos, módulos de entrenamiento y validación, módulos de inferencia, versionamiento de modelos y monitorización de data shift para el re-entrenamiento.
Nivel alto de inglés.




Nos encantaría si:

Estás acostumbrado a trabajar con algunos de los siguientes paradigmas: series temporales, NLP, análisis geoespacial, reconocimiento de imágenes, etc.
Tienes conocimientos sobre técnicas de optimización numérica: gradient descent, quasi-Newton, computación evolutiva, programación lineal, etc.
Has trabajado con soluciones cloud orientadas a Inteligencia Artificial: GCP (Vertex), AWS (Amazon SageMaker), Azure (MLFlow). Y la realización de prototipos/productos web en frameworks ágiles.
Tienes experiencia con entornos Big Data y haber tratado volúmenes de datos que requieran entornos distribuidos (pyspark y Databricks).
Que poseas conocimientos en herramientas de visualización: Tableau, Power BI, Qlik Sense, Shiny, Spotfire, etc.




Beneficios de trabajar en VML The Cocktail

🧐 Flexibilidad horaria
✈️ 25 días de vacaciones al año + nochebuena y nochevieja + 2 días en Semana Santa

Show more
HTML:
¿Quienes somos?

VML The Cocktail es una compañía de transformación creativa, que trabaja con el objetivo de combinar creatividad, diseño, tecnología y datos para crear productos, marcas, servicios y empresas que se relacionan con las personas, diseñando historias para el día de mañana.

Trabajamos en proyectos end to end con nuestros clientes, desde que surge una necesidad hasta todo el desarrollo y la implementación de los mismos. Nos gusta entender a fondo el reto de cada proyecto y, con todo el talento que tenemos en casa, nos aseguramos de llevarlo a cabo con éxito.



El área de Data & Marketing

Desde Data Marketing, estamos buscando al mejor talento para incorporarse a nuestro equipo. En esta área trabajan más de 200 profesionales abarcando todas las capacidades que engloban el mundo del dato y del marketing digital. Es un área en pleno crecimiento y con grandes retos por delante.


¿Por qué estamos creciendo tanto?

  • Como partners del año de Salesforce, estamos a la vanguardia de la tecnología y ofrecemos las soluciones más innovadoras a nuestros clientes
  • Nos destacamos en el mercado por nuestro enfoque integral
  • Tomamos decisiones estratégicas basadas en datos
  • Trabajamos en entornos globales


¿Quieres ser parte de este crecimiento? Esto es lo que buscamos:

Estamos buscando un Data Scientist creativo y orientado a resultados para unirse a nuestro equipo. En este rol, tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar con grandes volúmenes de datos, descubrir patrones clave y aportar insights valiosos que impulsarán nuestras decisiones estratégicas.


Si disfrutas resolver problemas complejos, experimentar con algoritmos avanzados y convertir números en historias, ¡queremos conocerte! 🚀


Responsabilidades

  • Trabajamos en entorno cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure) y usamos las herramientas adecuadas para cada problema en concreto.
  • Traducir las necesidades de negocio a modelos predictivos, su dimensionamiento y productivización, así como la activación y monitorización de estas predicciones en relación a los OKRs.
  • Desarollar modelos matemáticos avanzados basados en técnicas de machine learning, especialmente en modelos predictivos de clasificación (i.e., bagging, boosting) y clusterización (i.e., K-means, Mean Shift).


Requisitos:

  • Experiencia de al menos 3 años en las funciones descritas.
  • Tener conocimientos de desarrollo de software, Object Oriented Programing, y manejo avanzado de Python: estructuras de datos y principales librerías (i.e., numpy, pandas, sklearn, Keras, Tensorflow, Pytorch).
  • Conocimientos de bases de datos relacionales y fuentes no relacionales/NoSQL.
  • Experiencia en metodología DevOps, contribución a repositorios git, monitorización del código mediante builds (docker) y testing, así como despliegues en entornos de UAT y productivos.
  • Experiencia en metodología MLOps, paquetización de modelos, módulos de entrenamiento y validación, módulos de inferencia, versionamiento de modelos y monitorización de data shift para el re-entrenamiento.
  • Nivel alto de inglés.


Nos encantaría si:

  • Estás acostumbrado a trabajar con algunos de los siguientes paradigmas: series temporales, NLP, análisis geoespacial, reconocimiento de imágenes, etc.
  • Tienes conocimientos sobre técnicas de optimización numérica: gradient descent, quasi-Newton, computación evolutiva, programación lineal, etc.
  • Has trabajado con soluciones cloud orientadas a Inteligencia Artificial: GCP (Vertex), AWS (Amazon SageMaker), Azure (MLFlow). Y la realización de prototipos/productos web en frameworks ágiles.
  • Tienes experiencia con entornos Big Data y haber tratado volúmenes de datos que requieran entornos distribuidos (pyspark y Databricks).
  • Que poseas conocimientos en herramientas de visualización: Tableau, Power BI, Qlik Sense, Shiny, Spotfire, etc.


Beneficios de trabajar en VML The Cocktail

  • 🧐 Flexibilidad horaria
  • ✈️ 25 días de vacaciones al año + nochebuena y nochevieja + 2 días en Semana Santa
  • 💻 Modelo híbrido, full remote o presencial.
  • 🎓 Plan de carrera personalizado y formación continua
  • 👩‍🏫 Mejora tu nivel de inglés con clases formativas
  • 🙌 No tenemos dress code. Ven como quieras a trabajar.
  • 🛍️ Descuentos exclusivos y tiempo para tu crecimiento.
  • 💳 Acceso a Cobee
  • 🤱🏼 Iniciativas de apoyo a la maternidad y políticas de igualdad y diversidad.


Próximos pasos.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a Tech Lead to lead cutting-edge Generative AI and Machine Learning projects. If you're passionate about shaping AI solutions and leading a talented team, this is the perfect opportunity to make a significant impact.




Responsibilities:

Lead and manage cross-functional teams to deliver Generative AI solutions at scale.
Design and implement AI systems using foundation models, LLMs, and multimodal models.
Drive the MLOps/LLMOps strategy, ensuring seamless deployment and monitoring of AI models.
Keep up to date with the latest developments in Generative AI, incorporating new technologies and tools.
Foster a culture of best practices, high-quality documentation, and continuous learning within the team.




What we’re looking for:

2+ years of technical leadership experience in AI/ML teams.
Strong experience with generative models (e.g. GPT, LLaMA, Diffusion models) applied to real-world use cases.
Proficiency in Python and SQL (bonus: PySpark, NoSQL).
Experience with RAG, prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and embeddings.
Familiarity with GenAI platforms like OpenAI, Hugging Face, and Google Vertex AI.
Knowledge of cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) and tools like Kubernetes, Docker, CI/CD.
Experience with LangChain, LangGraph, Scikit-learn, and PyTorch is a plus.




Soft Skills:

Strong communication skills, able to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Problem-solving mindset with an ability to think analytically.
Experience with Agile methodologies and tools like Jira.
English proficiency (B2–C1 level).

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

We are looking for a highly skilled Data Scientist with expertise in building AI-powered applications. We will be building GenAI solutions end-to-end: from concept, through prototyping, productization, to operations. The ideal candidate will bring technical expertise in Natural Language Processing (NLP), especially leveraging Large Language Models (LLM) and proficiency in prompt engineering techniques.

Key Responsibilities:


Generative AI Application Development: Collaborate with AI engineers, product owners, business analysts and other developers in Agile teams to integrate LLMs into scalable, robust, fair and ethical end-user applications, focusing on user experience, relevance, and real-time performance
Algorithm Development: Design, develop, customize, optimize, and fine-tune LLM-based and other AI-infused algorithms tailored to specific use cases such as text generation, summarization, information extraction, chatbots, AI agents, code generation, document analysis, sentiment analysis, data analysis, etc
Data Curation for LLMs: Design data pipelines to curate, preprocess, and structure datasets that improve LLM-based algorithms performance and reduce biases, with a focus on data quality and diversity
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Perform thorough data exploration to understand dataset characteristics, uncover patterns, detect biases, and identify data quality issues; use statistical and visualization techniques to inform feature engineering, model selection, and optimization of LLM-based applications
Support in Prompt Engineering: support prompt engineers, business analysts and subject matter experts in crafting and optimizing prompts to guide LLM outputs, enhancing performance for specific tasks; be ready to participate in prompt engineering when necessary
Experimentation and Validation: Conduct rigorous experimentation, including A/B testing, to evaluate algorithm performance against benchmarks and control groups; use metrics specific to generative AI as well as pre-GenAI techniques, as required
Software Development: Apply software development best practices, including writing unit test; contribute to configuring CI/CD pipelines, containerizing applications, setting up APIs, ensuring robust logging, experiment tracking, and model monitoring
Continuous Improvement: Collaborate with other developers to monitor deployed algorithms, identify areas for improvement, and collaborate on updates to enhance performance
Stakeholder Communication: Translate complex technical results into clear, actionable insights for stakeholders, driving data-driven decision-making across the organization
Ethical AI and Bias Mitigation: Implement techniques to identify and mitigate biases in LLM outputs, ensuring responsible and ethical AI deployment
Pre-generative AI Application Development: Design and implement classical machine learning and NLP models (e.g., regression, classification, clustering, sequence modeling) when they provide a more efficient, interpretable, or cost-effective solution compared to LLMs; integrate these models into AI applications as needed


Requirements:


B.Sc., B.Eng., M.Sc., M.Eng., Ph.D. or D.Eng. in Computer Science, Physics, Statistics, Mathematics or equivalent degree and experience with Artificial Intelligence
Experience: 3+ years working with advanced machine learning algorithms
3+ years of hands-on experience working with language models, especially those based on Transformer architectures (e.g. BERT, T5, RoBERTa), and at least 1 year of experience with generative large language models (e.g. GPT, LLaMA, Claude, Cohere, etc.)
Technical Skills: Advanced proficiency in Python and experience with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow; expertise with Transformer architectures; hands-on experience with LangChain or similar LLM frameworks
Experience with designing end-to-end RAG systems using state of the art orchestration frameworks (hands on experience with fine-tuning LLMs for specific tasks and use cases considered as an additional advantage)
Practical overview and experience with AWS services to design cloud solutions, familiarity with Azure is a plus; experience with working with GenAI specific services like Azure OpenAI, Amazon Bedrock, Amazon SageMaker JumpStart, etc.
Data Skills: Strong skills in data manipulation, annotation, and crafting datasets that maximize LLM effectiveness; experience in working with data stores like vector, relational, NoSQL databases and data lakes through APIs; experience with data augmentation techniques or synthetic data generation in the context of LLMs considered as a plus
Prompt Engineering: Hands-on experience with prompt design, zero-shot, and few-shot learning paradigms to optimize LLM performance without extensive training or fine-tuning
Evaluation Metrics: Deep understanding of generative model and pre-GenAI evaluation techniques
NLP Expertise: Solid foundation in natural language processing, including tokenization, embeddings, attention mechanisms, and transfer learning specific to LLMs
Statistical Knowledge: Strong background in statistics, machine learning algorithms, and optimization techniques
Classical Machine Learning & NLP: Experience with traditional NLP techniques and classical machine learning algorithms (e.g., decision trees, SVMs, random forests, gradient boosting) for text analysis and structured data applications
Pre-LLM Model Development: Hands-on experience developing and deploying machine learning models for tasks such as classification, clustering, regression, and sequence modeling using frameworks like Scikit-learn, XGBoost, or traditional NLP pipelines
Feature Engineering & Data Preprocessing: Strong skills in feature engineering, dimensionality reduction, text preprocessing, and structured data transformation to improve model performance
Deployment: Experience in deploying LLM models with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and machine learning workbenches for robust and scalable productization
Proficiency in best practices of software engineering
Problem Solving: Excellent analytical skills and the ability to tackle complex challenges with innovative solutions
Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences


The successful candidate should also:


be passionate about AI and stay up-to-date with the latest developments in LLMs, GenAI, and AI in general
be team-oriented, proactive, and collaborative
be an excellent problem solver and analytical thinker
be detail-oriented and highly organized
be willing to learn and expand their skill set
have the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
be able to communicate in English at the level of: C1+
be located near the Central European time zone, or willing to work at a time consistent with the Central European time zone


Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

Let’s build a healthier future, together.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Actualmente buscamos un/a Data Scientist con experiencia en GIS y ganas de aprender dentro de un proyecto de banca.

Requisitos Mínimos


Titulación universitaria en Ciencia de Datos, Geografía, Estadística, Informática o similar
+3 años de experiencia en análisis de datos geoespaciales y financieros
Conocimiento avanzado en #GIS (ArcGIS, QGIS) y en Python, R, SQL
Valorable: Inglés alto
Show more
HTML:
Cognodata es una empresa líder en el sector de Customer Science y en Marketing Automation, dedicada a la generación de resultados de negocio mediante la gestión avanzada de la información de clientes, liderando cambios del sector y mejora de su posición competitiva.

Actualmente buscamos un/a Data Scientist con experiencia en GIS y ganas de aprender dentro de un proyecto de banca.

Funciones y Responsabilidades

  • Analizar grandes volúmenes de datos geoespaciales y financieros
  • Desarrollar modelos predictivos
  • Proporcionar insights estratégicos para la toma de decisiones en banca
  • Reporting

Habilidades Necesarias

  • Compromiso 💪
  • Iniciativa 🚀
  • Comunicación efectiva 🗣️
  • Autonomía 🤝
  • Capacidad de adaptación 🌍

Podemos ofrecerte:

Un Puesto Dinámico En El Sector Bancario Donde Podrás Desarrollar Tus Habilidades y Contribuir Al Éxito De Nuestros Proyectos. Además

  • 📄 Contrato indefinido.
  • 🚀 Carrera profesional: ¡tú decides hasta dónde quieres llegar!
  • 📚 Formación: udemy, LKD learning, plataformas de idiomas...
  • 😊 Buen ambiente laboral
  • 💵 Retribución flexible: guardería, trnasporte y/o restaurante.
  • ⏰ Flexibilidad horaria
  • 🕒 Horario: jornada completa
  • 🏠 Teletrabajo: híbrido.

¿Quieres conocer más? ¡Ínscribete!

Requisitos mínimos

Requisitos Mínimos

  • Titulación universitaria en Ciencia de Datos, Geografía, Estadística, Informática o similar
  • +3 años de experiencia en análisis de datos geoespaciales y financieros
  • Conocimiento avanzado en #GIS (ArcGIS, QGIS) y en Python, R, SQL
  • Valorable: Inglés alto

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Equifax is where you can power your possible. If you want to achieve your true potential, chart new paths, develop new skills, collaborate with bright minds, and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you.

Equifax is looking for a Data Scientist to join their Data Science team in Iberia. The ideal candidate for this role has strong analytical skills and is keen to work in innovation projects, contributing to generate new NPI for Equifax Iberia and its clients.

This is an excellent opportunity to develop a professional career in an international environment, working with cut-off cloud tools and collaborating with senior analytics professionals.

What You Will Do


Utilize combined knowledge of data structures, analytic algorithms/models and strong


computer science fundamentals to prepare datasets, conduct analytics, and develop

deployable solutions with guidance from more senior resources.


Leverage knowledge of data structures and algorithms to run complex data analysis.
Able to analyze and prepare complex and new data sources and incorporate them into


analytical solutions.


Research new methodologies and their applications in current and future process and business lines.
Works on moderate complexity tasks in problems often within multiple business or


analytical domains, collaborating with other teams to develop predictive models, risk.

assessments, fraud detection, recommendation engines, etc.


Package, summarize and visualize analytical findings and results for management.
Evaluate the work of peer and/or junior data scientists to ensure high quality solutions.


What experience you need


BS degree, preferably in mathematics, statistics or equivalent discipline.
At least 4 years of experience in a related analytical role, including experience with the design and development of predictive models
Cloud certification strongly preferred.
Technical capabilities including Python (required), SQL (required), BigQuery, GCP, R, MS Excel / Google Sheets, Vertex AI, TensorFlow, Gemini, Hugging Face, Airflow.
Languages: High proficiency in both English and Spanish are required.


What Could Set You Apart


Artificial Intelligence & Generative AI - Utilize artificial intelligence and generative AI to improve process efficiency, effectiveness and products.
Collaboration - work collaboratively across different projects, communicating technical details to technical and non-technical stakeholders. Manage own priorities within and across teams.
Consultancy Business Acumen - Have a good understanding of business and operational processes, related market segments and technical intricacies to identify how analytical solutions can cover a commercial/business problem.
Decision Modeling - Understand advanced statistical concepts used to contribute to the development of stress tested deployable machine learning algorithms (Logistic Regression, Xgboost, Neural Networks, etc.).
Leadership and Teamwork - Participate in a collaborative and productive team environment and take charge of technical and self development.
Problem Solving - Utilize hypothesis based problem solving to deliver pragmatic resolutions to business problems.
Statistical Programming - Execute and contribute to version controlled code and make use-case-specific modifications as needed. Manipulate and work with unstructured/structured, small and big data.


We offer comprehensive compensation and healthcare packages, paid time off, flexible schedules, and organizational growth potential through our online learning platform with guided career tracks.

Are you ready to power your possible? Apply today, and get started on a path toward an exciting new career at Equifax, where you can make a difference!

Who is Equifax?

At Equifax, we believe knowledge drives progress. As a global data, analytics and technology company, we play an essential role in the global economy by helping employers, employees, financial institutions and government agencies make critical decisions with greater confidence.

We work to help create seamless and positive experiences during life’s pivotal moments: applying for jobs or a mortgage, financing an education or buying a car. Our impact is real and to accomplish our goals we focus on nurturing our people for career advancement and their learning and development, supporting our next generation of leaders, maintaining an inclusive and diverse work environment, and regularly engaging and recognizing our employees. Regardless of location or role, the individual and collective work of our employees makes a difference and we are looking for talented team players to join us as we help people live their financial best.

Equifax is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Title: Científico de datos
Description:
En Lognext llevamos más de 18 años identificando e implementando soluciones tecnológicas prácticas que nos permitan seguir avanzando y optimicen nuestras operaciones, acompañando a los equipos con talento experto de alto rendimiento y haciendo de la tecnología una fuerza transformadora en nuestro día a día.




Buscamos un Data Scientist con talento para incorporarse a nuestro equipo para una multinacional líder en el sector asegurador.




🔍¿Qué buscamos?

Formación deseable en matemáticas o estadística. Se valorará positivamente el Máster en Big Data
2 ó 3 años de experiencia en puestos de Data Science.
Conocimiento de Python y Spark. Deseable Scala.
Conocimientos en Large Language Models (LLMs) e implementación de soluciones basadas en IA generativa, utilizando herramientas como LangChain o LlamaIndex. Valoramos también experiencia en machine learning tradicional.
Capacidad para realizar análisis y preparación de datos así como modelos de ML cumpliendo los estándares necesarios para su puesta en producción.




🛠️ Funciones y responsabilidades

Evolución y mantenimiento de los distintos proyectos de Data e IA desplegados por el equipo de Data Science del grupo
Trabajo con negocio en la identificación de posibles mejoras para los proyectos ya desplegados en producción.
Desarrollo de los evolutivos identificados.
Análisis de posibles mejoras en los proyectos.
Incorporación de buenas prácticas y nuevas técnicas.
Gestión de incidentales con soporte del Data Scientist responsable del proyecto.




🏆 ¿Qué ofrecemos?

💰Salario Competitivo
📍Modalidad hibrida (1 día a la semana)
💼Retribución flexible
🚀 Bono de formación anual
⏰ Flexibilidad horaria
✈️ 23 días de vacaciones
🏆 Referral Program




Únete a un equipo de NEXTERS que van más allá, un equipo donde la creatividad, el ingenio y la audacia marcan la diferencia en un mundo lleno de oportunidades.




En Lognext apostamos por la igualdad entre mujeres y hombres y prueba de ello tenemos Plan de Igualdad registrado y publicado. Y así mismo, creemos que en la multiculturalidad existe una fuente de valores, experiencias y conocimiento, que aportan valor añadido a nuestros proyectos, es por ello por lo que creemos en la diversidad y estamos comprometidos con ella. Trabajamos día a día para crear entornos en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad sin importar de donde vengas, no discriminamos por motivos de raza, religión o creencias, etnia, discapacidad, edad, nacionalidad, estado civil, orientación sexual o género.




#Empleo #Tecnología #Innovación #DesarrolloProfesional #Igualdad #Diversidad.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Who are we?

We are a company expert in helping others grow through our technological expertise, solving complex technological challenges, and focusing on operational excellence.

Since 2012, we have grown annually at an average rate of 30%, and for three consecutive years, we have been one of the fastest-growing companies in Europe according to the Financial Times.


We are digital natives and technology-neutral thanks to our rapid adaptation capabilities and problem-solving skills in any business situation.
We are passionate about technology challenges that have a significant impact on business. To address these, we have high-performance teams and the ability to quickly and effectively combine technologies.
We support our clients in their digital evolution to achieve maximum efficiency in their businesses, leveraging our extensive multi-sector experience.


We invite you to get to know us in depth by exploring the various sections of our website: https://www.innocv.com/

What will you do?

The work involves designing and implementing AI solutions aligned with business needs and technological standards. It includes applying techniques like Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to improve the precision and relevance of AI interactions, as well as developing Agentic RAGs, which incorporate autonomous agents to refine data retrieval and content generation. The development of AI agents and agent networks, capable of solving complex problems and interacting with each other, is central to the process. Tools such as LangChain are used to create modular architectures for agents specializing in tasks like information retrieval, contextual inference, and data-driven decision-making. Large Language Models (LLMs) such as Gemini and Llama are leveraged for tasks like text generation and question answering, with added security measures to ensure appropriate content.

Additionally, the work involves designing and managing data ingestion pipelines, implementing serverless architectures and Pub/Sub models to scale data intake, and using DevOps and MLOps practices for automating the deployment and management of AI models. APIs are integrated to connect AI models with external systems and to register events and metadata. Performance optimization includes analyzing system performance, detecting bottlenecks, and implementing caching strategies to improve response times. The strategy also emphasizes collaboration with designers and product teams to ensure AI solutions meet real business and user needs, while maintaining innovation through continuous research and experimentation with new AI technologies.

What do we value?

Essential:


Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, C++, and R.
Experience with AI frameworks and libraries like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Advanced knowledge of LLMs and their applications.
Experience with RAG techniques and Agentic RAGs.
Development of agent-based systems and tools like LangChain.
Experience with cloud platforms such as Google Cloud, AWS, and Azure, including AI services.
Familiarity with containers and microservices (Docker, Kubernetes).
Knowledge of data ingestion and processing.
Experience in API development and integration.
Knowledge of databases, including vector databases.
Skills in DevOps and MLOps for automating and managing the AI model lifecycle.


If you are someone who likes to stay updated on the latest trends, is eager to try new technologies, and enjoys finding alternative ways to do things, this is the place for you. If you consider yourself a team player who advocates for Fair Play above all... a team is waiting for you!

What do we offer you?

In this company, you can be yourself and work with colleagues equally passionate about technology and innovation, ready to support you at all times. We want to see you evolve and grow with us. To that end, we invest in your professional development with training, tech breakfasts, and attendance at forums. We are advocates of continuous learning, which is why we provide a personal budget for staying up to date with market trends.

We care about well-being and happiness at work, which is why we listen to needs to offer the best working conditions in a unique human environment. Due to the emphasis we place on flexibility and work-life balance, we won the Madrid Flexible Company Award in 2020 and received an honorable mention in 2022.

This is a WIN-WIN, and we have 42 benefits to offer you, but here are some highlights:

💻 100% remote work

⏰ Flexible hours

👏 Special timetable: Fridays and summer 7h.

📖 Individual budget for attending forums and training

🏅 English classes

🩺 Health insurance

🏖️ Every three years, 6 extra days off.

🎁 Day off on your birthday

🗣️ Bring a friend and benefit from it

🥳 Flexible compensation

🧘‍♂️ Wellness - Gympass

🌳 Volunteering opportunities

🎊 Company events and team buildings

To learn more about us, the protagonists of INNOCV will share more about the company.

If you identify with our work philosophy and share our passion for INNOvation and Code Vocation, we want to meet you!

We are committed to supporting the LGTBIQ+ community and invite individuals with disabilities to apply for this position. We value diversity and are committed to inclusion in our team.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
En IT Partner España, estamos buscando un/a Data Scientist con experiencia en Python y Cloud (AWS) para incorporarse a un proyecto estratégico internacional en colaboración con una entidad financiera Alemana.

Buscamos a una persona con visión técnica, pasión por los datos y curiosidad por el mundo de la Inteligencia Artificial aplicada (IA Generativa, Langgraph, RAGs), que se una a un equipo dinámico, innovador y altamente cualificado.

🔍 ¿Qué harás?


Desarrollarás soluciones Data Driven robustas y escalables usando Python (FastAPI, Poetry).
Participarás en proyectos experimentales con IA Generativa (Langgraph, RAGs), aplicando modelos sobre arquitecturas modernas.
Diseñarás e implementarás pipelines y APIs en AWS, usando servicios como Lambda, Aurora y API Gateway.
Colaborarás con equipos DevOps y Data para mantener procesos de CI/CD y prácticas modernas de infraestructura como código (CDK Python o Terraform).
Formarás parte de un entorno internacional, con interlocución directa en inglés y colaboración con equipos distribuidos.


✅ Requisitos mínimos


+3 años de experiencia como Data Scientist o perfil mixto con enfoque en desarrollo backend en entorno data.
Dominio de Python, especialmente frameworks como FastAPI y herramientas como Poetry.
Experiencia con contenedores (Docker) y Git (Gitlab).
Experiencia real con AWS (imprescindible), idealmente habiendo trabajado con Lambda, Aurora y API Gateway.
Nivel de inglés C1 o superior. Se validará en entrevista.


⭐ Se valorará positivamente


Experiencia en Langgraph o RAGs (no es necesario expertise, pero sí nociones prácticas).
Conocimiento en Infraestructura como código: AWS CDK (Python) o Terraform.
Experiencia previa en entornos financieros o proyectos internacionales.


📍 Ubicación


Preferencia por candidatos ubicados en nuestras sedes (España/Alemania), con modelo híbrido.
También se valorarán candidaturas 100% remotas si encajan perfectamente en lo técnico y comunicativo.


🎯 ¿Qué ofrecemos?


Proyecto internacional de gran visibilidad en el sector financiero.
Equipo técnico de alto nivel y retos tecnológicos reales.
Contrato estable con paquete competitivo acorde a experiencia.
Flexibilidad horaria y posibilidad de trabajo remoto.
Entorno internacional y multicultural con inglés como lengua vehicular.


¿Estás listo para el siguiente reto en tu carrera como Data Scientist?

¡Queremos conocerte! 🚀
Show more

  • Contrato estable con paquete competitivo acorde a experiencia.
  • Flexibilidad horaria y posibilidad de trabajo remoto.
  • Entorno internacional y multicultural con inglés como lengua vehicular.

¿Estás listo para el siguiente reto en tu carrera como Data Scientist?

¡Queremos conocerte! 🚀

Title: Data Scientist - GenAI
Description:
WPP is the creative transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients, and communities.

Working at WPP means being part of a global network of more than 100,000 talented people dedicated to doing extraordinary work for our clients. We operate in over 100 countries, with corporate headquarters in New York, London and Singapore.

WPP is a world leader in marketing services, with deep AI, data and technology capabilities, global presence and unrivalled creative talent. Our clients include many of the biggest companies and advertisers in the world, including approximately 300 of the Fortune Global 500.

Our people are the key to our success. We're committed to fostering a culture of creativity, belonging and continuous learning, attracting and developing the brightest talent, and providing exciting career opportunities that help our people grow.

Visit our LinkedIn page to see what we're up to!

Why we're hiring:

WPP is at the forefront of the marketing and advertising industry's largest transformation. Our Global CIO is leading a significant evolution of our Enterprise Technology capabilities, bringing together over 2,500 technology professionals into an integrated global team. This team will play a crucial role in enabling the ongoing transformation of our agencies and functions.

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics team, with a strong focus in the application of Generative AI and Large Language Models (LLMs). You will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and implementing Machine Learning models as well as Generative AI solutions. You will work closely with corporate stakeholders as well as with Data Engineers and Data Analysts to ensure our AI applications are robust, scalable, and impactful. The Advanced Analytics team seats under the Head office Data team based in London, which oversights corporate business data. This position will be based in our Madrid office, but you will collaborate with our global team on a daily basis.

What you'll be doing:


Developing GenAI & Machine Learning solutions to solve complex business problems.
Testing new state-of-the-art models for multiple use cases (summarisation, classification, chatbots…). Research new methods and techniques in AI/ML to improve processes and methodologies.
Evaluating, fine-tuning, and optimizing existing LLM solutions and improve the output quality with more efficient methods.
Assessing models’ performance in production and report on development status, identify risk areas, and support the wider EDG team in identifying cost-efficient solutions leveraging GenAI models.
Performing statistical analysis on existing and new datasets to help SME stakeholders identify areas for improvement.
Presenting technical solutions and findings to non-technical stakeholders successfully.


What you'll need:


Experience building GenAI solutions with LLMs and familiarity with both open source and Proprietary LLMs.
Advanced LLMs knowledge including prompt engineering, model optimization, and building knowledge databases.
Experience with common Machine Learning frameworks and methods and developing business-oriented data solutions (e.g., data mining, process optimisation, predictive modelling).
NLP models and techniques.
Experience working on the data lifecycle of multidisciplinary projects: from dataset creation and EDA to building production-ready pipelines for AI/ML projects.
Previous experience with Databricks for developing and managing machine learning workflows.


Who you are:

You're open: We are inclusive and collaborative; we encourage the free exchange of ideas; we respect and celebrate diverse views. We are open-minded: to new ideas, new partnerships, new ways of working.

You're optimistic: We believe in the power of creativity, technology and talent to create brighter futures or our people, our clients and our communities. We approach all that we do with conviction: to try the new and to seek the unexpected.

You're extraordinary: we are stronger together: through collaboration we achieve the amazing. We are creative leaders and pioneers of our industry; we provide extraordinary every day.

What we'll give you:

Passionate, inspired people – We aim to create a culture in which people can do extraordinary work.

Scale and opportunity – We offer the opportunity to create, influence and complete projects at a scale that is unparalleled in the industry.

Challenging and stimulating work – Unique work and the opportunity to join a group of creative problem solvers. Are you up for the challenge?

We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we’ve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office around four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.

WPP is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

Please read our Privacy Notice (https://www.wpp.com/people/wpp-privacy-policy-for-recruitment) for more information on how we process the information you provide.

Title: Global Data Scientist (Data Analyst)
Description:
Havas is one of the world’s largest global communications groups, operating in over 100 countries. The Group is made up of three major divisions: Creative, Media and Health & Wellness communication.

We have a multi-disciplinary offering, united under one leadership, all in one building: advertising, media, data, technology, digital, social, mobile, CRM, UX, sports and entertainment, public relations, corporate communications, healthcare, design, research, employer branding and recruitment. Havas is the only truly integrated marketing and communications company in the UK.

Our mission is to unite brands and people through meaningful connections, driving business success. We are the fastest growing of the global networks and have a challenger brand mentality. We share one common purpose: to bring media and creative closer together for the benefit of our clients.

Havas Global is a dedicated team supporting global clients across strategy, insight, media, creative, health and digital. The culture of our group is best described as dynamic, entrepreneurial, and collaborative.

With meaningful ideas at its heart, the Converged strategy harnesses Havas’ standout creativity, media, and production resources, powered by the best data, technology and AI, bringing its global expertise, tools and capabilities, even closer to meet its clients’ needs.

We are solely immersed in global assignments and have the experience and understanding to fulfil the needs and challenges of global clients. We believe in modelling team structures after those of our clients and are set up to meet the unique requirements of each, from centralised one-hub market management to more coordinated or decentralised needs, adding value by leveraging central and local expertise and the totality of our clients’ investments.

Job Summary

As a key member of the Global Product team, you will be leading the Product Development team and the media planning & budget optimization of global data products. You will also be implementing the development, evolution and adoption of those global products for our Converged proprietary platform.

You will be supporting Product Owners and Market Champions with the design and development of media planning & budget optimization models and solutions, including reach & cost modelling for the network and users of the platform at a global level, whilst ensuring alignment with organizational goals, and maximizing user adoption.

Mission & Responsibilities


General Experience: 3+ years of professional experience in advanced analytics & data science, providing a broader perspective and adaptability to tackle a variety of tasks and challenges with success.
Media Knowledge: Comprehensive understanding of the media landscape, valuable project experience in the sector. This knowledge is important for navigating the complex ecosystem, understanding key players, and applying strategies effectively across various media channels. Nice to have experience in media planning and budget optimization analytical models.
Analytical & Technical Skills: A strong analytical mindset with a solid understanding of mathematics and probability. Experience applying these skills to media-specific models such as reach curves and budget optimization is fundamental.
Programming Knowledge: A strong understanding of programming, particularly in Python and/or R (or another programming language such as SAS, Matlab, etc.), to support data analysis and modeling. Proficiency is not required, but he/she should be comfortable working with these tools for handling and processing data. Nice to have a solid understanding of machine learning basics, including both supervised and unsupervised learning techniques. Important to have experience leading analytical model development projects and to have experience in software product development projects.
Insights Background: Experience in extracting actionable insights from data is highly valuable. The ability to analyze and interpret data to provide meaningful, data-driven recommendations is key for influencing decisions and strategies.
Cloud Platform Knowledge: A well-based understanding of cloud platforms, with an emphasis on Google Cloud Platform (GCP), as the ecosystem increasingly points toward cloud-based solutions for data management and scalability.
Personal Skills: A proactive, resourceful individual who seeks solutions and embraces innovative approaches. Must be able to stay focused, effectively land ideas, and break down complex problems into actionable steps. Comfortable investigating new possibilities and finding creative solutions to challenges that may not have predefined answers.


Previous Experience & Industry Background


3+ experience in advanced analytics, data and digital international transformation projects.
Proven success in leading large-scale, technology-driven change initiatives.
Previous experience in a media agency would be appreciated.


Qualification & Languages


University Degree in Sciences, Computing, Engineering with a specialization in data & analytics.
Languages: English (Fluent).


Soft Skills & Competencies  


Ability to lead complex initiatives/projects and perform tasks in an efficient and self-sufficient manner.
Strong written and verbal communication skills to interact and engage with stakeholders at all levels of the organization (global, local, regional, business unit).
Team management would be a plus
Ability to work in a multicultural and multinational environment, with sensitivity to cultural communication styles.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to anticipate and address change-related challenges.
Perfect knowledge of MS office tools.
Strong interpersonal skills such as creativity and curiosity.
Familiar with digital marketing channels & planning strategies.
Show more
